column4: http://ati.amd.com/support/drivers/linux/linux-radeon.html is a start, it also has a link to a wiki that has howtos
Elite.. wiki for specific ubuntu install/setup ?
it used to, I don't know if they've updated since the last driver release
in fact, http://wiki.cchtml.com/index.php/Ubuntu
also, I'd recommend doing a search on ubuntuforums.org for your card, and seeing if anyone has done it
I was asking the room :) but it's actually an ATI script that's supposed to check your machine to make sure you meet all pre-requisites for the drivers
Oh.. Yeah, I know how to run scripts
I'm actually just in here trying to get this video ard working for a buddy of mine
could you tell me how to launch this script? Just clicking it doesn't do anything. Damn my years of windows and linux noobiness.
sh ati-whatever.run
it's called check.sh
Do what I said. chmod +x check.sh and then when you want to run it you just do ./check.sh or wherever it is.. /home/erdaron/check.sh
alright, that did it... but it says "not running from the console or do not have console ownership" even if I run it as sudo
Whats in your script ?
Use the pastebin and lets see whats in your script
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/28302/
Oh, its that ati script
I guess all it really needs is to check version of XFree86. Terminal from Applications / Accessories?
Run that thing on the console (ctrl+alt+F1), see what happens..
same thing happened :)
No idea
any other way I can check the version of XFree86?
Xfree86 is xorg now
did you find the info you were looking for?
